lines.text: We can't do that!
How do you know? You never tried it.
Well, yeah, but I never tried shooting myself in the head neither.
What are you being so mean for, Miss? A man takes a drop too much once in a while, it's only human nature.
Nature, Mr. Allnut, is what we are put in this world to rise above.

[exasperated and angry]
Well I ain't sorry for you no more, ya crazy, psalm-singing, skinny old maid!
By the authority granted to me by his Imperial Majestey Kaiser Wilhelm the Second I pronounce you man and wife - proceed with the execution.
Dear?... Dear?... What is your first name?
leeches. Filthy little devils.
Nobody in Africa, but yours truly, can get a good head of steam on the old African Queen.
I don't know why the Germans would want this God-forsaken place.
God has not forsaken this place, Mr. Allnut, as my brother's presence here bears witness.
How'd you like it?
Like it?
White water rapids!
I never dreamed...
I don't blame you for being scared - not one bit. Nobody with good sense ain't scared of white water...
I never dreamed that any mere physical experience could be so stimulating!
All this fool talk about The Louisa. Goin' down the river...
What do you mean?
I mean we ain't goin' to do nothin' of the sort.
Why, of course we're going! What an absurd idea!
What an absurd idea! What an absurd idea! Lady, I may be a born fool, but you got ten absurd ideas to my one, an' don't you forget it!

[his stomach is growling]
Ain't a thing I can do about it.
You know why did the chicken cross the road.

[missing the joke]
I beg your pardon.
Nevermind, miss.
Mr. Allnut! Mr. Allnut, you may come in out of the rain!

[after travelling through the rapids]
Now that I've had a taste of it I don't wonder why you love boating.

[as Charlie tries to stop her from revealing their plan]
Oh stop it, Charlie, we've been through all that. I'm certainly not going to outlive you and that's all there is to it!

[Annoyed with Charlie and Rosie]
I think I shall have to hang you twice.

Dear Lord, We've come to the end of our journey, and in a little while we'll stand before you. I pray for you to be merciful. Judge us not for our weaknesses, but for our love and open the doors of heaven for Charlie and me.
Who do you think you are ordering me about?
I'm the captain, that's what!
There ain't nothing so complicated as the inside of a torpedo.
Let's go while the going's good.
Nothin' a man can't do if he sets his mind to it. Never say die. That's my motto!
Fancy me a heroine.
It's a great thing to have a lady aboard with clean habits. It sets the man a good example. A man alone, he gets to living like a hog.

[about the drinking water they'll get from the engine's radiator]
Of course, it'll taste a little rusty, but we can't have everything, can we?

[after Charlie checks the boat for damage after going down a rather rough set of rapids]
Could you see anything, dear?
Yeah. The shaft's twisted like a corkscrew and there's a blade gone off the prop.
We'll have to mend it, then.

[skitting Rose]
Can you make a torpedo? Well do so Mr. Allnut.
[repeated line]
Mr. Allnut?
Yes, miss.
What a time we had Rosie, what a time we had.
